channel.title: IMES - Infix notation Mathematical Expression Solver
channel.description:
Here's a little project I wrote this weekend. It's a mathematical expression solver, that takes infix expressions, converts them to postfix, and solves. Example: [code] [java] Tokenized: 1 + ( ( 3 / 3 ^ 2 ) * ( 4 - 1 ) ) + ( 1 / 2 ) * ( ( 2 ^ 4 ) / 32 ) [java] Outfix: 1 3 3 2 ^ / 4 1 - * + 1 2 / 2 4 ^ 32 / * + [java] Result: 2.25 [/code] Sorry the documentation is a little minimal. See the IMES class in package imes for simple usage or Test.java for a little more complicated example. The postfix->infix translator uses the Shunting Yard Algorithm (http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Shunting_yard_algorithm) and the solving is a simple stack based RPN calculator (http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Reverse_Polish_notation). Enjoy!
(I will probably be updating when i get more time, and adding more functionality)

item.title: IMES - Infix notation Mathematical Expression Solver
item.dc:creator: @BobDole81 BobDole81
item.description:
@BobDole81 wrote:

That’s a great way of doing it. I remember a long while back, I did a formula parser for a physics calculator that would isolate certain variables using horrible string manipulation and parenthesis insertion. Very nice job Stork
